results.title: Simvastatin, transdermal patch, and oral estrogen-progestogen preparation in early-postmenopausal hypercholesterolemic women: a randomized, placebo-controlled clinical trial.
results.text_hl: In this 24-week, placebo-controlled trial, 60 consecutive healthy @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ aged >/= 45 years, with @<m>DISEASE_Amenorrhea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000568 @@@amenorrhea@@@ from 6 to 60 months (mean, 1.9 +/- 1.4 years), serum follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) greater than 40 U/L, and slight to moderate @DISEASE_Hypercholesterolemia @DISEASE_MESH:D006937 @@@hypercholesterolemia@@@ (low-density lipoprotein-cholesterol [LDL-C] 160 to 250 mg/dL, high-density lipoprotein-cholesterol [HDL-C] < 75 mg/dL, and @CHEMICAL_Triglycerides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014280 @@@triglycerides@@@ < 200 mg/dL) were enrolled and randomized to dietetic advice (placebo group), @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 10 mg, 0.625 mg of conjugated equine estrogen (CEE), or 50 microg estrogen transdermal patch (ETP).

citations.NLM: Vigna GB, Donegà P, Zanca R, Barban A, Passaro A, Pansini F, Bonaccorsi G, Mollica G, Fellin R. Simvastatin, transdermal patch, and oral estrogen-progestogen preparation in early-postmenopausal hypercholesterolemic women: a randomized, placebo-controlled clinical trial. Metabolism. 2002 Nov;51(11):1463-70. PMID: 12404199
